output.value: [format('{0}{1}{2}{3}{4}{5}{6}{7}', parameters('chars')[parameters('nr1')], parameters('chars')[parameters('nr2')], parameters('chars')[parameters('nr3')], parameters('guid'), parameters('numbers')[parameters('nr1')], parameters('numbers')[parameters('nr2')], parameters('alphaUpper')[parameters('nr5')], parameters('alphaUpper')[parameters('nr4')])]

randomString.defaultValue: [__bicep.generatePassword(parameters('baseRandomString'), parameters('randomNr1'), parameters('randomNr2'), parameters('randomNr3'), parameters('randomNr4'), parameters('randomNr5'), parameters('randomChar'), parameters('randomNumber'), parameters('randomAlpha'))]

variables.script:
#!/bin/bash

tenant_token={0}
signup_domain={1} 


package_not_found () {
    echo "<><><> Package not Found for $1 - Exiting" 
    exit 1
}

failed_vlzconnector_install () {
    echo "<><><> Failed to install vlzconnector on $1 - Exiting"
    exit 1
}

if [ -f /etc/os-release ]; then
    # freedesktop.org and systemd
    . /etc/os-release
    OS=$NAME
    VER=$VERSION_ID
elif type lsb_release >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    # linuxbase.org
    OS=$(lsb_release -si)
    VER=$(lsb_release -sr)
elif [ -f /etc/lsb-release ]; then
    # For some versions of Debian/Ubuntu without lsb_release command
    . /etc/lsb-release
    OS=$DISTRIB_ID
    VER=$DISTRIB_RELEASE
elif [ -f /etc/debian_version ]; then
    # Older Debian/Ubuntu/etc.
    OS=Debian
    VER=$(cat /etc/debian_version)
fi

echo "<><><> Running connector deploy on $OS"

if [[ "$OS" = "Ubuntu" ]]; then
    sudo curl --fail https://${signup_domain}/connector/ubuntu/vlzconnector.list -o /etc/apt/sources.list.d/vlzconnector.list || package_not_found $OS
    sudo mkdir -p /opt/vlzconnector
    echo -n ${tenant_token} | sudo tee -a /opt/vlzconnector/tenantToken
    sudo apt update
    sudo DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt install -q -y vlzconnector || failed_vlzconnector_install $OS
elif [[ "$OS" = "Amazon Linux" ]]; then
    sudo curl --fail https://${signup_domain}/connector/amzn/amzn.repo -o /etc/yum.repos.d/volumez.repo || package_not_found $OS
    sudo mkdir -p /opt/vlzconnector
    echo -n ${tenant_token} | sudo tee -a /opt/vlzconnector/tenantToken
    sudo yum -y install vlzconnector || failed_vlzconnector_install $OS
elif [[ "$OS" = "SLES" ]]; then
    sudo curl --fail https://${signup_domain}/connector/sles/sles.repo -o /etc/zypp/repos.d/volumez.repo || package_not_found $OS
    sudo mkdir -p /opt/vlzconnector
    echo -n ${tenant_token} | sudo tee -a /opt/vlzconnector/tenantToken
    sudo zypper --non-interactive install -y vlzconnector || failed_vlzconnector_install $OS
elif [[ "$OS" = "Red Hat Enterprise Linux" ]]; then
    sudo curl --fail https://${signup_domain}/connector/rhel/rhel.repo -o /etc/yum.repos.d/volumez.repo || package_not_found $OS
    sudo mkdir -p /opt/vlzconnector
    echo -n ${tenant_token} | sudo tee -a /opt/vlzconnector/tenantToken
    sudo yum -y install '--exclude=kernel*' --nobest vlzconnector || failed_vlzconnector_install $OS
else
    echo "$OS - is not supported - exiting"
    exit 1
fi

echo "<><><> Finished Connector install on $OS!"

metadata.name: Virtual Networks
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network (vNet).
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The name of the Virtual Network (vNet).
Optional. Location for all resources.
Required. An Array of 1 or more IP Address Prefixes for the Virtual Network.
Optional. An Array of subnets to deploy to the Virtual Network.
Optional. DNS Servers associated to the Virtual Network.

Optional. Resource ID of the DDoS protection plan to assign the VNET to. If it's left blank, DDoS protection will not be configured. If it's provided, the VNET created by this template will be attached to the referenced DDoS protection plan. The DDoS protection plan can exist in the same or in a different subscription.
Optional. Virtual Network Peerings configurations.

Optional. Indicates if encryption is enabled on virtual network and if VM without encryption is allowed in encrypted VNet. Requires the EnableVNetEncryption feature to be registered for the subscription and a supported region to use this property.
Optional. If the encrypted VNet allows VM that does not support encryption. Can only be used when vnetEncryption is enabled.

Optional. The flow timeout in minutes for the Virtual Network, which is used to enable connection tracking for intra-VM flows. Possible values are between 4 and 30 minutes. Default value 0 will set the property to null.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The Name of the subnet resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent virtual network. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The address prefix for the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the network security group to assign to the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the route table to assign to the subnet.
Optional. The service endpoints to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The delegations to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the NAT Gateway to use for the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private endpoint in the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.
Optional. List of address prefixes for the subnet.
Optional. Application gateway IP configurations of virtual network resource.
Optional. Array of IpAllocation which reference this subnet.
Optional. An array of service endpoint policies.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.
The address prefix for the subnet.
List of address prefixes for the subnet.

metadata.name: Virtual Network Peerings
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Peering.
Optional. The Name of Vnet Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be localVnetName-remoteVnetName.
Conditional. The name of the parent Virtual Network to add the peering to. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. If we need to verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.

metadata.name: Virtual Network Peerings
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Peering.
Optional. The Name of Vnet Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be localVnetName-remoteVnetName.
Conditional. The name of the parent Virtual Network to add the peering to. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. If we need to verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.
The resource group the virtual network was deployed into.
The resource ID of the virtual network.
The name of the virtual network.
The names of the deployed subnets.
The resource IDs of the deployed subnets.
The location the resource was deployed into.

azureBastion.properties: [union(createObject('scaleUnits', if(equals(parameters('skuName'), 'Basic'), 2, parameters('scaleUnits')), 'ipConfigurations', createArray(createObject('name', 'IpConfAzureBastionSubnet', 'properties', union(createObject('subnet', createObject('id', format('{0}/subnets/AzureBastionSubnet', parameters('virtualNetworkResourceId')))), createObject('publicIPAddress', createObject('id', if(not(empty(parameters('bastionSubnetPublicIpResourceId'))), parameters('bastionSubnetPublicIpResourceId'), reference('publicIPAddress').outputs.resourceId.value)))))), 'enableKerberos', parameters('enableKerberos')), if(equals(parameters('skuName'), 'Standard'), createObject('enableTunneling', equals(parameters('skuName'), 'Standard'), 'disableCopyPaste', parameters('disableCopyPaste'), 'enableFileCopy', parameters('enableFileCopy'), 'enableIpConnect', parameters('enableIpConnect'), 'enableShareableLink', parameters('enableShareableLink')), createObject()))]

metadata.name: Public IP Addresses
metadata.description: This module deploys a Public IP Address.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.

Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The domain name label. The concatenation of the domain name label and the regionalized DNS zone make up the fully qualified domain name associated with the public IP address. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.

Required. The domain name label scope. If a domain name label and a domain name label scope are specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system with a hashed value includes in FQDN.
Optional. The Fully Qualified Domain Name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.

Optional. The reverse FQDN. A user-visible, fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.
Required. The resource ID of the DDOS protection plan associated with the public IP address.
Required. The DDoS protection plan associated with the public IP address.
Required. The DDoS protection policy customizations.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The name of the Public IP Address.
Optional. Resource ID of the Public IP Prefix object. This is only needed if you want your Public IPs created in a PIP Prefix.
Optional. The public IP address allocation method.
Optional. A list of availability zones denoting the IP allocated for the resource needs to come from.
Optional. IP address version.
Optional. The DNS settings of the public IP address.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Name of a public IP address SKU.
Optional. Tier of a public IP address SKU.
Optional. The DDoS protection plan configuration associated with the public IP address.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The idle timeout of the public IP address.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.

metadata.name: Network Security Group (NSG) Security Rules
metadata.description: This module deploys a Network Security Group (NSG) Security Rule.
Required. The name of the security rule.
Conditional. The name of the parent network security group to deploy the security rule into. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Whether network traffic is allowed or denied.
Optional. A description for this rule.

Optional. The destination address prefix. CIDR or destination IP range. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as "VirtualNetwork", "AzureLoadBalancer" and "Internet" can also be used.
Optional. The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.
Optional. The application security group specified as destination.
Optional. The destination port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all ports.
Optional. The destination port ranges.
Required. The direction of the rule. The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic.

Required. The priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.
Required. Network protocol this rule applies to.

Optional. The CIDR or source IP range. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as "VirtualNetwork", "AzureLoadBalancer" and "Internet" can also be used. If this is an ingress rule, specifies where network traffic originates from.
Optional. The CIDR or source IP ranges.
Optional. The application security group specified as source.
Optional. The source port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all ports.
Optional. The source port ranges.
The resource group the security rule was deployed into.
The resource ID of the security rule.
The name of the security rule.
The resource group the network security group was deployed into.
The resource ID of the network security group.
The name of the network security group.
The location the resource was deployed into.

Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.

Optional. The custom IP address prefix that this prefix is associated with. A custom IP address prefix is a contiguous range of IP addresses owned by an external customer and provisioned into a subscription. When a custom IP prefix is in Provisioned, Commissioning, or Commissioned state, a linked public IP prefix can be created. Either as a subset of the custom IP prefix range or the entire range.
Optional. A list of availability zones denoting the IP allocated for the resource needs to come from.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

Optional. Specifies the properties of the Public IPs to create and be used by the NAT Gateway.
Optional. Specifies the properties of the Public IP Prefixes to create and be used by the NAT Gateway.
Optional. A list of availability zones denoting the zone in which Nat Gateway should be deployed.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags for the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

parameters.name: [if(contains(coalesce(parameters('publicIPAddressObjects'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'name'), createObject('value', coalesce(parameters('publicIPAddressObjects'), createArray())[copyIndex()].name), createObject('value', format('{0}-pip', parameters('name'))))]

metadata.name: Public IP Addresses
metadata.description: This module deploys a Public IP Address.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The domain name label. The concatenation of the domain name label and the regionalized DNS zone make up the fully qualified domain name associated with the public IP address. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.

Required. The domain name label scope. If a domain name label and a domain name label scope are specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system with a hashed value includes in FQDN.
Optional. The Fully Qualified Domain Name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.

Optional. The reverse FQDN. A user-visible, fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.
Required. The DDoS protection plan ID associated with the public IP address.
Required. The DDoS protection policy customizations.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The name of the Public IP Address.
Optional. Resource ID of the Public IP Prefix object. This is only needed if you want your Public IPs created in a PIP Prefix.
Optional. The public IP address allocation method.
Optional. A list of availability zones denoting the IP allocated for the resource needs to come from.
Optional. IP address version.
Optional. The DNS settings of the public IP address.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Name of a public IP address SKU.
Optional. Tier of a public IP address SKU.
Optional. The DDoS protection plan configuration associated with the public IP address.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The idle timeout of the public IP address.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: The resource group the public IP address was deployed into.
The name of the public IP address.
The resource ID of the public IP address.
The public IP address of the public IP address resource.
The location the resource was deployed into.

parameters.name: [if(contains(coalesce(parameters('publicIPPrefixObjects'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'name'), createObject('value', coalesce(parameters('publicIPPrefixObjects'), createArray())[copyIndex()].name), createObject('value', format('{0}-pip', parameters('name'))))]

metadata.name: Public IP Prefixes
metadata.description: This module deploys a Public IP Prefix.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Required. Name of the Public IP Prefix.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Required. Length of the Public IP Prefix.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.

Optional. The customIpPrefix that this prefix is associated with. A custom IP address prefix is a contiguous range of IP addresses owned by an external customer and provisioned into a subscription. When a custom IP prefix is in Provisioned, Commissioning, or Commissioned state, a linked public IP prefix can be created. Either as a subset of the custom IP prefix range or the entire range.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: The resource ID of the public IP prefix.
The resource group the public IP prefix was deployed into.
The name of the public IP prefix.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The name of the NAT Gateway.
The resource ID of the NAT Gateway.
The resource group the NAT Gateway was deployed into.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Proximity Placement Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Proximity Placement Group.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Required. The name of the proximity placement group that is being created.
Optional. Specifies the type of the proximity placement group.
Optional. Resource location.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the proximity placement group resource.
Optional. Specifies the Availability Zone where virtual machine, virtual machine scale set or availability set associated with the proximity placement group can be created.
Optional. Describes colocation status of the Proximity Placement Group.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Specifies the user intent of the proximity placement group.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: The name of the proximity placement group.
The resourceId the proximity placement group.
The resource group the proximity placement group was deployed into.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Virtual Machine Scale Sets
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Machine Scale Set.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. Name of the VMSS.
Optional. Location for all resources.

Optional. This property can be used by user in the request to enable or disable the Host Encryption for the virtual machine. This will enable the encryption for all the disks including Resource/Temp disk at host itself. For security reasons, it is recommended to set encryptionAtHost to True. Restrictions: Cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your virtual machine scale sets.
Optional. Specifies the SecurityType of the virtual machine scale set. It is set as TrustedLaunch to enable UefiSettings.

Optional. Specifies whether secure boot should be enabled on the virtual machine scale set. This parameter is part of the UefiSettings. SecurityType should be set to TrustedLaunch to enable UefiSettings.
Optional. Specifies whether vTPM should be enabled on the virtual machine scale set. This parameter is part of the UefiSettings.  SecurityType should be set to TrustedLaunch to enable UefiSettings.
Required. OS image reference. In case of marketplace images, it's the combination of the publisher, offer, sku, version attributes. In case of custom images it's the resource ID of the custom image.

Optional. Specifies information about the marketplace image used to create the virtual machine. This element is only used for marketplace images. Before you can use a marketplace image from an API, you must enable the image for programmatic use.

Required. Specifies the OS disk. For security reasons, it is recommended to specify DiskEncryptionSet into the osDisk object. Restrictions: DiskEncryptionSet cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VM Scale sets.

Optional. Specifies the data disks. For security reasons, it is recommended to specify DiskEncryptionSet into the dataDisk object. Restrictions: DiskEncryptionSet cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VM Scale sets.

Optional. The flag that enables or disables a capability to have one or more managed data disks with UltraSSD_LRS storage account type on the VM or VMSS. Managed disks with storage account type UltraSSD_LRS can be added to a virtual machine or virtual machine scale set only if this property is enabled.
Required. Administrator username.
Optional. When specifying a Windows Virtual Machine, this value should be passed.
Optional. Custom data associated to the VM, this value will be automatically converted into base64 to account for the expected VM format.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Fault Domain count for each placement group.
Optional. Resource ID of a proximity placement group.
Required. Configures NICs and PIPs.
Optional. Specifies the priority for the virtual machine.
Optional. Specifies the eviction policy for the low priority virtual machine. Will result in 'Deallocate' eviction policy.
Optional. Specifies the maximum price you are willing to pay for a low priority VM/VMSS. This price is in US Dollars.
Optional. Specifies that the image or disk that is being used was licensed on-premises. This element is only used for images that contain the Windows Server operating system.
Optional. Required if name is specified. Password of the user specified in user parameter.
Optional. The configuration for the [Domain Join] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Anti Malware] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Monitoring Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. Resource ID of the monitoring log analytics workspace.
Optional. The configuration for the [Dependency Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Network Watcher Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.

Optional. The configuration for the [Azure Disk Encryption] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed. Restrictions: Cannot be enabled on disks that have encryption at host enabled. Managed disks encrypted using Azure Disk Encryption cannot be encrypted using customer-managed keys.
Optional. The configuration for the [Desired State Configuration] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Custom Script] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. Storage account boot diagnostic base URI.
Optional. Storage account used to store boot diagnostic information. Boot diagnostics will be disabled if no value is provided.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.

Optional. Specifies the mode of an upgrade to virtual machines in the scale set.' Manual - You control the application of updates to virtual machines in the scale set. You do this by using the manualUpgrade action. ; Automatic - All virtual machines in the scale set are automatically updated at the same time. - Automatic, Manual, Rolling.

Optional. The maximum percent of total virtual machine instances that will be upgraded simultaneously by the rolling upgrade in one batch. As this is a maximum, unhealthy instances in previous or future batches can cause the percentage of instances in a batch to decrease to ensure higher reliability.

Optional. The maximum percentage of the total virtual machine instances in the scale set that can be simultaneously unhealthy, either as a result of being upgraded, or by being found in an unhealthy state by the virtual machine health checks before the rolling upgrade aborts. This constraint will be checked prior to starting any batch.

Optional. The maximum percentage of the total virtual machine instances in the scale set that can be simultaneously unhealthy, either as a result of being upgraded, or by being found in an unhealthy state by the virtual machine health checks before the rolling upgrade aborts. This constraint will be checked prior to starting any batch.
Optional. The wait time between completing the update for all virtual machines in one batch and starting the next batch. The time duration should be specified in ISO 8601 format.

Optional. Indicates whether OS upgrades should automatically be applied to scale set instances in a rolling fashion when a newer version of the OS image becomes available. Default value is false. If this is set to true for Windows based scale sets, enableAutomaticUpdates is automatically set to false and cannot be set to true.
Optional. Whether OS image rollback feature should be disabled.
Optional. Specifies whether automatic repairs should be enabled on the virtual machine scale set.

Optional. The amount of time for which automatic repairs are suspended due to a state change on VM. The grace time starts after the state change has completed. This helps avoid premature or accidental repairs. The time duration should be specified in ISO 8601 format. The minimum allowed grace period is 30 minutes (PT30M). The maximum allowed grace period is 90 minutes (PT90M).
Optional. Specifies the computer name prefix for all of the virtual machines in the scale set.

Optional. Indicates whether virtual machine agent should be provisioned on the virtual machine. When this property is not specified in the request body, default behavior is to set it to true. This will ensure that VM Agent is installed on the VM so that extensions can be added to the VM later.

Optional. Indicates whether Automatic Updates is enabled for the Windows virtual machine. Default value is true. For virtual machine scale sets, this property can be updated and updates will take effect on OS reprovisioning.
Optional. Specifies the time zone of the virtual machine. e.g. 'Pacific Standard Time'. Possible values can be `TimeZoneInfo.id` value from time zones returned by `TimeZoneInfo.GetSystemTimeZones`.
Optional. Specifies additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup. - AdditionalUnattendContent object.
Optional. Specifies the Windows Remote Management listeners. This enables remote Windows PowerShell. - WinRMConfiguration object.
Optional. Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled.
Optional. The list of SSH public keys used to authenticate with linux based VMs.
Optional. Specifies set of certificates that should be installed onto the virtual machines in the scale set.
Optional. Specifies Scheduled Event related configurations.
Optional. Specifies whether the Virtual Machine Scale Set should be overprovisioned.

Optional. When Overprovision is enabled, extensions are launched only on the requested number of VMs which are finally kept. This property will hence ensure that the extensions do not run on the extra overprovisioned VMs.
Optional. Whether to force strictly even Virtual Machine distribution cross x-zones in case there is zone outage.

Optional. When true this limits the scale set to a single placement group, of max size 100 virtual machines. NOTE: If singlePlacementGroup is true, it may be modified to false. However, if singlePlacementGroup is false, it may not be modified to true.
Optional. Specifies the scale-in policy that decides which virtual machines are chosen for removal when a Virtual Machine Scale Set is scaled-in.
Required. The SKU size of the VMs.
Optional. The initial instance count of scale set VMs.
Optional. The virtual machine scale set zones. NOTE: Availability zones can only be set when you create the scale set.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Required. The chosen OS type.
Generated. Do not provide a value! This date value is used to generate a registration token.

Optional. SAS token validity length to use to download files from storage accounts. Usage: 'PT8H' - valid for 8 hours; 'P5D' - valid for 5 days; 'P1Y' - valid for 1 year. When not provided, the SAS token will be valid for 8 hours.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'SystemAssigned,UserAssigned', 'SystemAssigned'), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', null())), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Virtual Machine Scale Set Extensions
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Machine Scale Set Extension.
Conditional. The name of the parent virtual machine scale set that extension is provisioned for. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the virtual machine scale set extension.
Required. The name of the extension handler publisher.
Required. Specifies the type of the extension; an example is "CustomScriptExtension".
Required. Specifies the version of the script handler.

Required. Indicates whether the extension should use a newer minor version if one is available at deployment time. Once deployed, however, the extension will not upgrade minor versions unless redeployed, even with this property set to true.
Optional. How the extension handler should be forced to update even if the extension configuration has not changed.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific settings.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific protected settings.

Optional. Indicates whether failures stemming from the extension will be suppressed (Operational failures such as not connecting to the VM will not be suppressed regardless of this value). The default is false.
Required. Indicates whether the extension should be automatically upgraded by the platform if there is a newer version of the extension available.
The name of the extension.
The ResourceId of the extension.
The name of the Resource Group the extension was created in.

Optional. How the extension handler should be forced to update even if the extension configuration has not changed.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific settings.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific protected settings.

Optional. Indicates whether failures stemming from the extension will be suppressed (Operational failures such as not connecting to the VM will not be suppressed regardless of this value). The default is false.
Required. Indicates whether the extension should be automatically upgraded by the platform if there is a newer version of the extension available.
The name of the extension.
The ResourceId of the extension.
The name of the Resource Group the extension was created in.
The resource ID of the virtual machine scale set.
The resource group of the virtual machine scale set.
The name of the virtual machine scale set.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.
